sentences: Huh Gak (Korean: 허각; born November 15, 1984) is a South Korean singer.
He rose to fame after winning the 2010 Mnet talent competition series Superstar K 2, during which he became known as "the Korean Paul Potts."
Early life and education
Huh Gak was born in Incheon, South Korea on November 15, 1984.
His parents divorced when he was three years old, and he and his twin brother, Huh Gong, were raised by their father.
Due to this family's financial difficulties, Huh dropped out of school after finishing middle school and worked worked as a repairman and event singer.
Huh later earned his high school diploma in 2018.

section: == Career == | === 2010–present: Superstar K 2, debut, and First Story ===

sentences: The album spawned the hit single "Hello," which took the #1 spot on the Gaon Digital Chart (also earning a "triple crown" for topping the component Download, Streaming, and BGM charts) and Billboard's K-pop Hot 100 chart.
section: == Career == | === 2010–present: Superstar K 2, debut, and First Story ===

sentences: On October 8, 2021, Huh Gak left Play M Entertainment after his contract expired.

section: == Career == | === 2010–present: Superstar K 2, debut, and First Story ===

sentences: Personal life ==
On October 3, 2013, Huh Gak married his "first love," whom he dated in middle school when they were 16 years old.
They met again after 13 years in February 2012.
Huh and his wife have two sons: Huh Geon (born 2014) and Huh Gang (born 2015).

Concerts ==
As well as numerous appearances on Superstar K2, on 18 January 2011, he participated in a Traditional Korean music concert called "Noon concert".
